intro: Schellolepis benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
